title: How to Make Strawberries and Cream Poke Cake

steps.headline: Bake the cake in a 9x13 inch (22cm x 28cm) baking pan.
steps.description: Use the original directions or instructions according to the recipe of your choice. Set the cake aside to cool completely.

steps.headline: Make the holes in the cake.
steps.description: Use the round tip at the end of a wooden spoon to create evenly portioned holes throughout the entire cake.

steps.headline: Make the Jello.
steps.description: Combine the Jello and boiling water in a medium bowl and stir to dissolve the Jello. Add the cold water and continue to stir. Pour the mixture over the cake.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the cake.
steps.description: Use plastic wrap to cover the cake and place it in the refrigerator to chill for a few hours. This allows the Jello to absorb and solidify into the cake.

steps.headline: Make and spread the frosting.
steps.description: Combine the powdered sugar, whipped cream, cream cheese, and vanilla in a large bowl. Use a rubber spatula to distribute the frosting evenly on the cake. Distribute the diced strawberries evenly around the cake.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the cake until it's ready to be served.

text: Bake the cake in a 9x13 inch (22cm x 28cm) baking pan. Use the original directions or instructions according to the recipe of your choice. Set the cake aside to cool completely. Make the holes in the cake. Use the round tip at the end of a wooden spoon to create evenly portioned holes throughout the entire cake. Make the Jello. Combine the Jello and boiling water in a medium bowl and stir to dissolve the Jello. Add the cold water and continue to stir. Pour the mixture over the cake. Refrigerate the cake. Use plastic wrap to cover the cake and place it in the refrigerator to chill for a few hours. This allows the Jello to absorb and solidify into the cake. Make and spread the frosting. Combine the powdered sugar, whipped cream, cream cheese, and vanilla in a large bowl. Use a rubber spatula to distribute the frosting evenly on the cake. Distribute the diced strawberries evenly around the cake. Refrigerate the cake until it's ready to be served.  Finished.
